title: jiya83095
author: jiya83095
content: Bitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam. These days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: There's no free money or bitcoin anywhere. Be wary of free money in any form cause even in Freetown nothing is free. This is my first time of hearing about a bitcoin bonus website  and I can't for sure say it's genuine or not but what I can throw at you as advise is that there are lots of scam schemes out there preying on the greed of those that want everything for free. So be careful.I can see you're a newbie and this is your second post on the forum. You're welcome. Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines,https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: You are in a Bitcoin forum, and everyone here (including me) will always give you positive feedback regarding Bitcoin based on our beliefs. Your title did not match your content; the title looks like you are asking a direct question, "Is Bitcoin real or not? That's by the way.About the Bitcoin bonus, without looking at the content of the link (impressive by the way newbie knowing how to add link into a text) I will boldly tell you that their is not good that can come out from sites which promise's you bonus of any kind, this are just means of attracting potential victims into their site with audio reward, which will convince them that they actually own Bitcoin Bitcoin they don't have access to (Not your key not your Bitcoin) and if the users is greedy enough they will want the users to pay some sort of fee before they will allow the users to withdraw the fund from their, or better still ask you to refer users to the site before you can be allowed to withdraw which will be a means of attracting more traffic for them to their site. My advice is to avoid such sites that give you a free Bitcoin bonus; they always end up being time-wasting stuff, and no one is giving free money anywhere else on the internet. Nothing comes too easy these days.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMBitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam.Don't stress yourself unnecessarily, most of this giveaway sites, threads or articles are scams, no one will give you bitcoin without participating in giving them service in return except they are gifting you and if in this case, maybe it has to be someone that knows you better can gift bitcoin to you, avoid all these bitcoin cloud mining website that promises free bitcoin, they are time wasters, make research very well about them before engaging in doing business with them.Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMThese days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. Don't be decieved, they only give you that on the screen but you cannot realize the money in reality, they keep enrolling you on a bunch of survey task to unlock your withdrawal and later said you have additional task or withdrawal limit which you must attain first.

comments.author: AicecreaME
comments.body: Seems like a lowkey promotion of that "Bitcoin Bonus" website. Free satoshis are too old, and the only one I've tried when I was a newbie was freebitco(.in), they are indeed giving free satoshis but I've never tried withdrawing it since it takes a lot of time before meeting the required amount for you to be able to withdraw your "free bitcoin". For me it's a waste of time believing in such nonsense, nothing is free anymore. You have to work hard in order to attain something.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AM-snip-The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. $5 bitcoin is a fair value bonus I think, it might come from some service exclusive offers like casino promos and referral program. Generally, it requires several conditions and tasks before it actually becomes claimable, such as sending KYC and a deposit of a certain value.However I would study carefully before sending money or any identity to a service, especially if the bonus figures offered are unreasonable.

comments.author: GideonGono
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMBitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam. These days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. There's nothing wrong in trying it, but if those site requires a minimum amount of deposit and that amount is a bit pricey in order to withdraw your bonus then better think and do some research before putting on some money in it.

comments.author: Aikidoka
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMBitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam. These days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. To be honest I never heard of it and after doing some research, I don't think it's legal and it appears to be a scam. If I'm not mistaken, the website in question is this one here. It looks like an ordinary website to me but there isn't much information available about it (like it's owner and if they have any other social as Twitter)I tried using a scam adviser site and it gave it a score of only 22 out of 100, which is considered low and indicates that it's not safe to use.

comments.author: irhact
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMBitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam. These days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. We have many Bitcoin faucet website that uses various names to attract traffic, maybe the site has other agenda that mightn't be harmful but don't make a deposit uf the site request for a deposit before you withdraw. If the site is just giving our free Bitcoin without requiring you to invest or do some online tasks then there's nothing wrong in claiming the free bonus.The first bonus might just be a welcome bonus and usually they'll demand you accumulate the bonuses to a certain amount before you can withdraw. Make sure the site isn't a scam or you'll do alot of tasks without been able to withdraw your money and it'll be a waste of time.

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: The funny thing is after all this warnings, some newbies will still proceed and try to look for a way to get bitcoin for free online and that is why they always keep falling into scam traps, they believe they know better, and after they get scammed they will return to share their bad experience. I will write it here for the sake of those who want to listen, there is no platform or website or any organisations that can give bitcoin for free to users without working for the Bitcoin.It is not possible and is never going to be possible, if anyone is promising you some Bitcoin for free it is a scam and the moment you start thinking otherwise is the moment that you have already fallen for the Trap.There is no free Bitcoin out there, don't fool yourself.

comments.author: demonica
comments.body: Well for me, free $5 isn't really that questionable since there are also others who offer something similar to that. But if the main purpose of that website it to give bonuses for no cost, then that's already suspicious. Why would they be giving free money to users without anything in return? They will just probably ask you to invest on their website in order to claim those bonuses which is a big big no. I tried searching about it but I don't know what website op is talking about... Just don't engage in something you're already in doubt about in the first place especially if there is only few information about them since you can't check if it's legit or not.

comments.author: macson
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMBitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam. These days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. i don't know your true purpose for creating this topic but i really believe you are marketing this site on a low budget and hoping to get some great feedback.  going back a few years ago there were many sites that offer bitcoin for free because the prices were still low and it was also easy to get them, but now the price of bitcoin is high and it's difficult to get them so those sites that claim they give bitcoins for free will mostly end up being a scam.advice for newbies who are just seeing, don't trust easily, and be tempted by sites that offer bitcoin for free because usually when you are going to make a withdrawal, they will make it difficult for you with various reasons and techniques like this has caused a lot of people to lose.

comments.author: Litzki1990
comments.body: These are totally scam campaigns. Always try to avoid such campaigns. Note that no campaign will pay you BTC. Fraudsters steal money from various members through such campaigns. I tell you how to do it.  First you need to create an account on the website where such campaign is conducted. After creating an account on that website, you will be asked to connect wallet from that website. When you connect your wallet to that website, your wallet access will go to them and your  If there is any money in the wallet then they will transfer that money immediately. These are complete scams so try to avoid such scams.

comments.author: bayudndy
comments.body: not a new form; sites are created a lot and advertised aggressively with many attractive rewards for new users. When you dig deeper, you won't be able to find any information related to the owner or any social networking sites related to it. This is very risky because they may be taking advantage of these newcomers' greed. So it's best to avoid them because, as they say, if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.

comments.author: Minecache
comments.body: Quote from: Z390 on May 26, 2023, 12:50:36 PM The funny thing is after all this warnings, some newbies will still proceed and try to look for a way to get bitcoin for free online and that is why they always keep falling into scam traps, they believe they know better, and after they get scammed they will return to share their bad experience. I will write it here for the sake of those who want to listen, there is no platform or website or any organisations that can give bitcoin for free to users without working for the Bitcoin.It is not possible and is never going to be possible, if anyone is promising you some Bitcoin for free it is a scam and the moment you start thinking otherwise is the moment that you have already fallen for the Trap.There is no free Bitcoin out there, don't fool yourself.  Everyone needs lessons and experiences to have lifelong experiences. No one can be born without learning to crawl, learn to walk but we already know how to run, before we can run, we have to fall hundreds of times to run fast. So I don't see anything funny here because I believe that you have also had similar thoughts and actions when you are a newbie. It's normal to lose money in investing, and I think we should let them have that experience. Because our advice will be useless because everyone has a big ego, and no one will listen until they have experienced it.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Op, one thing you should know is that most Dev you see nowadays are here to make money nothing else so if you see any site or promo claiming they want to give you any bonus it's probably a tactics to get you to use their site (if the site offers anything ).Rule of thumb, there are no free money online neither are they any free site that gives you free Bitcoin the only one I could think of that does those kind of thing is faucets and currently the payment you receive there is equivalent to nothing.Quote from: AicecreaME on May 26, 2023, 12:03:23 PMSeems like a lowkey promotion of that "Bitcoin Bonus" website. ~~~I won't be surprised if the Op of this thread is behind that website because if you check the day that article was published it's not a long time. The date there is 25th of May. But, it's still possible that Op came across the post and decided to share with us.

comments.author: zanezane
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMBitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam. These days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. I dont get the logic why would a site give to a new comer, but I get the fact when a promoter tries to promote it and when using their link will give you that 5 dollar. A promoter will gain percentage to those who spend using their link, looks like this bitcoin bonus doesn't have that kind of tech. If some called out that this link is a scam, maybe its truly a scam maybe they experienced being scam by that website. Also, just to make new users aware and to be careful to those scam sites. They will not give free money without return.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMBitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam. These days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. One thing you must first and foremost know is that, there is no free money anywhere, even in free town, though I've not checked, but the site you mentioned most likely, would be a scam, even though it doesn't appear to be at the moment.First, if the site is not a bitcoin faucet site, where users are required to solve captcha to earn a very small amount of bitcoin,And secondly, the site does not offer any kind of services which users might be required to participate in using bitcoin..Then be rest assured it's a scam site, as no website at the moment will pay users bitcoin simply for signing up on the website, bitcoin is very precious to every one this days, even to scammers, everyone wants bitcoin.

comments.author: Rigon
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 26, 2023, 11:39:13 AMBitcoin bonus is a website that claim to user can earn bitcoin for no cost. But user now have a question is bitcoin bonus real or a scam. These days people are caught in scams specially online scam so people are scared to believe online website. But bitcoin bonus is well updated website and designed and developed by professional people. The first bonus given to new comer is $5, which is a catch here, why would anyone give money just for signing up on website. One thing you should always remember is that nothing can be earned for free. People who promise to give something for free are the biggest scams. As far as I know, I have not heard of any such site till date where you can get bitcoins just by making an account. All these sites are created to trap many people who are new they don't understand anything they make an account and get there bonus asking them to make a deposit to withdraw that bonus. Later when they deposit they freeze their deposit and they are given many conditions which the customer cannot fulfill thus they fall into the trap of fraud. In my advice I would say such websites should be banned now.

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: The current bitcoin bonus is a scam and not real. But they can get satoshi from the faucet, especially from freebitco.in because that site still gives satoshi to users.If those people were to look for any other information, they would know it was a scam. They need to stay away from it before the site asks them to send some money before the site sends them money. It is a scam because once users send their money, they will never get any money from the site. Be careful with such offers, and don't trust them if you don't know.
